intro: Korthalsella salicornioides, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that resemble those of sea holly (Crithmum). The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in coastal environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Korthalsella salicornioides is adapted to saline conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
